availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Born in Virginia, lived in Woodford and Henry County. Married with eight children, including John W. Mathews. Started Henry Academy and Henry Female College in New Castle in 1850. Secretary of Henry County until 1865.

bibl.p: Kentucky: A History of the State, 6th Edition. Shelby County (Battle. Perrin and Kniffin. 1887); Journal of the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky (Frankfort, Kentucky: A.G. Hodges & Company, 1850); Acts Passed at the ... Session of the General Assembly for the Commonwealth of Kentucky, Volume 2. (Frankfort, Kentucky: John J. Harney, 1867).
